speed_limits.notes: 130 km/h is the recommended limit (Richtgeschwindigkeit) on Autobahns. No limit only where indicated by white circular sign with diagonal lines.

alcohol_limit.notes: Strict 0.00% for drivers under 21 or with license held <2 years.

rules.seatbelt_rules: Mandatory for all passengers. Fine: â‚¬30+.
rules.phone_usage_rules: Handheld strictly prohibited. Engine must be off to touch phone (Start-Stop doesn't count).
rules.headlights_rules: Required in tunnels, rain, fog. Daylight running lights are standard.
rules.priority_rules: 'Rechts vor Links' (Right before Left) at all unmarked intersections. Priority roads marked by yellow diamond.

tolls.notes: Passenger cars are toll-free on Autobahns. Some Alpine tunnels/passes have fees.

rules.parking_rules: Parking disc (Parkscheibe) required in blue zones. Strictly enforced. Do not park against traffic flow.
rules.winter_rules: Winter or All-season tires (Alpine symbol) mandatory in winter conditions (ice, snow, slush).

summary: Germany is famous for its efficient Autobahns, but rules are strictly enforced. Right-before-left is the golden rule in residential areas. Stick to the right lane on highways unless passing.

rental_and_idp_notes: Valid domestic license usually accepted. IDP recommended for non-EU/EEA licenses.

regional_variations.notes: Environmental Zone (Umweltzone) requires Green Sticker for entry. Heavy traffic and scarce parking.
Very strict parking enforcement. Mittlerer Ring often congested.
